Name: Written Work
Description: A written work is any type of intellectual work expressed through writing. It is a fairly generic or abstract type that contains information common to all or most types of written works, including (but not limited to) books, plays, poems, stories, scholarly articles, book reviews, and essays. Written Work should not be co-typed with Publication.

Properties.Name: Copyright date
Properties.Description: The date or dates that this work was copyrighted

Properties.Name: Date of first publication
Properties.Description: The date that this work was first published, in any form.

Properties.Name: Date written
Properties.Description: The date this work was completed, if known.

Properties.Name: Next in series
Properties.Description: If this work is part of a series, the work that occurs next in that series. For works of fiction, this should usually follow the internal chronology.

Properties.Name: Online versions
Properties.Description: Links to online versions of this work.

Properties.Name: Original language
Properties.Description: The language(s) in which this work was first composed.

Properties.Name: Part of series
Properties.Description: A literary series can be a variety of things: a series of novels or other works of fiction that tell a continuing story such as Frank Herbert's "Dune" series, Lawrence Durrell's "Alexandria Quartet," or Aeschylus' "Oresteia"; a poem cycle; a set of related essays; and so on.

Properties.Name: Subjects
Properties.Description: A list of topics that this work is about.

Properties.Name: Translations
Properties.Description: Translations of this work. The translation's name as it is given in the target language of the translation.
